document_title: Finger tenosynovitis: Causes, symptoms, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
In most cases, finger tenosynovitis usually only causes discomfort and inconvenience in daily activities without causing serious complications. However, patients should not be subjective because of that. If the condition is not treated promptly, the disease can progress and cause many dangerous problems. Specifically:
Infection: Easy to recognize signs are hot and inflamed finger joints; The finger will be permanently stuck in a folded position: This makes daily activities and movements very difficult and inconvenient.; Many fingers can become stiff and numb at the same time, causing pain and difficulty in daily activities.
